seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 30 / Seats Avail: 14Waitlist Total: 0
course_description: This course covers topics in behavioral economics and finance, including quasi-experiments and tests of market efficiency, bounded rationality and household behavior, limit of arbitrage, bubbles and crashes, social interactions, and implications of market inefficiency for corporate behavior.
prerequisites: (ECON 101 or ECON_OX 101) and (ECON 112 or ECON_OX 112) and (ECON 201 or ECON_OX 201) or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 3345, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 7-8:15p, Instructor: K. Lanier, Status: Open
